"THROUGH ADMINISTRATIVE PROCESSES." Subsection (a) of section 7 of the Civil Rights of Institutionalized Persons Act is amended to require prisoners to present their claims regarding prison conditions to facility officials before adjudication under federal law. This presentation must provide reasonable notice to the officials within the applicable limitations period for filing suit. The court may stay an action for up to 90 days if a claim has not been presented as required, directing prison officials to consider the claim through administrative process. The court must proceed with the action after the stay, unless notified by the parties that it has been resolved. SEC. 4. EXEMPTION OF JUVENILES FROM PRISON LITIGATION REFORM ACT. The amendments to Title 18 and the Civil Rights of Institutionalized Persons Act exclude child prisoners from certain provisions, defining "prison" and excluding prisoners under 18 years old. The amendments to Title 28 and the Civil Rights of Institutionalized Persons Act exclude individuals under 18 years old from certain provisions related to prisoners. SEC. 5 amends Section 1915(g) of title 28, inserting a time limit for multiple in forma pauperis claims and removing language regarding failure to state a claim. SEC. 6 modifies Section 1915(b)(1) by specifying conditions for filing fees in forma pauperis. SEC. 7 makes a technical amendment to resolve ambiguity. SEC. 7 amends Section 1915(a)1) of title 28 by clarifying the statement of assets a person possesses. SEC. 8 encourages appropriate settlement of prisoner litigation. SEC. 9 addresses judicial discretion in crafting prison abuse remedies. SEC. 9 amends Section 3626 of title 18, United States Code, by adjusting provisions related to judicial discretion in crafting prison abuse remedies. This includes eliminating certain sentences, adding conditions for demonstrating the elimination of violations, allowing for extensions of time periods for correction of violations, and removing specific paragraphs. The amendments made by this Act will apply to all pending and future cases in Federal court.
